content:
• Wednesday, April 24, 2013
  • MLNX

    More on Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX): Q1 beats on both EPS and revenue, but net earnings...

    More on Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX): Q1 beats on both EPS and revenue, but net earnings swung to a loss as the data-storage company reported sharply higher operating expenses. The company also issued downbeat guidance for the current quarter, now expecting revenue to come in between $92.5M and $97.5M, below Street estimates of $108M. Shares -6.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 PM
  • AKAM

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Akamai (AKAM - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $368M-$378M and EPS of...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Akamai (AKAM - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $368M-$378M and EPS of $0.44-$0.46 vs. a consensus of $363.3M and $0.45. 2) Angie's List (ANGI - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $58.5M-$59.5M, above a $57.1M consensus. 3) ServiceNow (NOW - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $94M-$96M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.04 vs. a consensus of $91.8M and -$0.02. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $394M-$398M, above a consensus of $379.8M. AKAM +17.1% AH. ANGI +6.9%. NOW -2% (Akamai PR) (Angie's List PR) (ServiceNow PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • ZNGA

    Though Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) beat Q1 estimates thanks to strong FarmVille 2 bookings, its...

    Though Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) beat Q1 estimates thanks to strong FarmVille 2 bookings, its quarterly metrics help explain its poor Q2 guidance. Daily active users (DAUs) fell 8% Q/Q and 21% Y/Y in Q1 to 52M, after having fallen 6% Q/Q in Q4. Monthly active users fell 15% Q/Q and 13% Y/Y to 253M, monthly unique payers fell 14% Q/Q and 30% Y/Y to 2.5M, and average daily bookings per DAU fell 2% Q/Q and 11% Y/Y to $0.055. Cost controls are keeping Zynga from witnessing huge cash burn: R&D spend -31% Y/Y, sales/marketing -52%, G&A -41%. Only $2.5M worth of buybacks took place. Can real-money gambling help turn the tide? Shares -9.2% AH. (Q4 data) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • SUPN

    Supernus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SUPN) announces a private offering of $75M in Convertible...

    Supernus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SUPN) announces a private offering of $75M in Convertible Senior Notes due 2019, with a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional $15M. The notes are being secured by liens on substantially all of SUPN's assets. Shares -14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM

  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) guides for FQ4 revenue of $3.55B-$3.65B and EPS of $1.65-$1.80,...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) guides for FQ4 revenue of $3.55B-$3.65B and EPS of $1.65-$1.80, in-line with a consensus of $3.58B and $1.74. That, along with a strong FQ3 beat, is going over well in light of huge PC-related fears. WDC +3.7% AH. STX +1.3%. LSI-OLD +2.2%. WDC estimates the total market for hard drives in FQ3 was 135.4M, down just slightly from FQ2's 135.8M. The company pegs its FQ3 share at 44.4%, up from FQ2's 43.6%. Gross margin rose 50 bps Q/Q (while falling 400 bps Y/Y) to 28.2%, and $243M worth of shares were repurchased. (fact sheet) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • FICO

    FICO (NYSE:FICO): FQ2 EPS of $0.69 in-line. Revenue of $179.3M (+12% Y/Y) misses by $7.75M....

    FICO (NYSE:FICO): FQ2 EPS of $0.69 in-line. Revenue of $179.3M (+12% Y/Y) misses by $7.75M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)

  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) is now up 10.9% AH following its FQ3 beat and strong FQ4 guidance. FQ3...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) is now up 10.9% AH following its FQ3 beat and strong FQ4 guidance. FQ3 gross margin was 59.9%, near the high end of a guidance range of 58%-60%; it's expected to drop in FQ4 to 56%-58%. The NexGen acquisition takes Fusion-io into the market for standalone storage gear, and does so in a surprising way, given the startup's products package Fusion-io's flash modules and software with standard hard drives. It's worth noting NexGen's products are aimed at SMBs - thus far, Fusion-io's modules have largely been sold to enterprises and major Internet services firms. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM

  • INTU

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) -9% AH after providing disappointing tax season data for its TurboTax...

    Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) -9% AH after providing disappointing tax season data for its TurboTax products/services, and lowering guidance as a result. The company now expects FQ3 (April quarter) revenue of $2.165B-$2.175B and EPS of $2.92-$2.94, below a consensus of $2.25B and $3.01. FY13 guidance is now for revenue of $4.495B-$4.52B and EPS of $3.31-$3.35, below a consensus of $4.59B and $3.44. Total TurboTax units rose 3% Y/Y over the 2012 season to 25.3M, and TurboTax eFiles rose 4% to 26.5M. Accounting Professionals and Small Business sales are expected to hit prior guidance. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • CAKE

    More on Cheesecake Factory's (NASDAQ:CAKE) Q1 results: Comps rose 2% excluding the negative...

    More on Cheesecake Factory's (NASDAQ:CAKE) Q1 results: Comps rose 2% excluding the negative impact (-0.6%) of storms in the Northeast. Results were "at the top end of expectations," a reflection of a "strong, relevant brand with ongoing menu innovation and high service levels." The company repurchased 1.2M shares in Q1 and says it will continue to return cash to shareholders and should return "to peak operating margins" with "mid-teens earnings growth." Shares now +7.31% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • EQIX

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Equinix (EQIX - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $530M-$534M, below a...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Equinix (EQIX - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $530M-$534M, below a consensus of $534.7M. 2013 revenue is expected to be greater than $2.2B vs. a consensus of $2.22B. 2) F5 (FFIV - earnings) expects FQ3 revenue of $355M-$365M and EPS of $1.06-$1.09, below a consensus of $369.7M and $1.06-$1.09. A new $200M stock buyback has been authorized. 3) Citrix (CTXS - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $705M-$715M and EPS of $0.62-$0.63 vs. a consensus of $711.5M and $0.70. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $2.95B-$2.98B and EPS of $3.08-$3.11 vs. a consensus of $2.97B and $3.14. EQIX -11.5% AH. FFIV -0.4%. CTXS -9.9%.

  • CLF

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF) Q1 results: U.S. iron ore pellet sales volume...

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF) Q1 results: U.S. iron ore pellet sales volume totaled 3.1M tons vs. 3.4M a year ago, mostly due one customer's bankruptcy last May; iron ore sales are historically lower during Q1 vs. other periods due to Great Lakes seasonal shipping constraints. Expects end markets for its products to remain healthy. Shares +6.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSCO

    More on Tractor Supply (NASDAQ:TSCO): Q1 results in-line, but same-store sales (+0.5%) faced a...

    More on Tractor Supply (NASDAQ:TSCO): Q1 results in-line, but same-store sales (+0.5%) faced a tough compare, as last year's Q1 was helped by an estimated $38M sales benefit from early spring weather. Gross margins fall to 32.4% from 32.6% due to a "continued mix shift to lower-margin C.U.E. products." Outlook: FY2013 EPS of between $4.32-4.40 on revenues of between $5.07-5.17B. Analysts see $4.44 on $5.16B. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • VAR

    More on Varian Medical (NYSE:VAR): FQ2 comes in line on EPS but beats on revenue as total sales...

    More on Varian Medical (NYSE:VAR): FQ2 comes in line on EPS but beats on revenue as total sales climbed 7% Y/Y. Net earnings rose 4.6% on broad sales growth, with its oncology segment sales improving 3% and x-ray products segment sales increasing 14%. Gross margin rose to 41.6% from 41.2%. The company cuts guidance for Q3 now saying it expects to earn an EPS of $0.98 - $1.02, versus $1.05 estimated by analysts. Shares -4.9% AH.

  • NORNQ

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR +34%) finishes the day solidly higher after Q1 losses came in narrower...

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR +34%) finishes the day solidly higher after Q1 losses came in narrower than Street expectations. Net sales decreased Y/Y, but this was primarily due to temporary external issues in its Alumina segment, which occurred because a larger portion of the Alumina segment's total volume was redirected in order to restock the company's supply chain following Q3-412 production issues in the Alumina segment.

    Ryder Systems (R +6.8%) recovers nearly all of the losses it posted Tuesday following its Q1...

    Ryder Systems (R +6.8%) recovers nearly all of the losses it posted Tuesday following its Q1 report as Wells Fargo upgrades the stock to Outperform from Market Perform. The company "is poised to deliver attractive earnings growth … as cyclical lease replacement helps drive modest top line growth," says analyst Anthony Gallo, apparently allaying investor concerns about R's top line miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • CVE

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +2%) says the sale of some of its Saskatchewan oil properties put on the...

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +2%) says the sale of some of its Saskatchewan oil properties put on the block earlier this year has been delayed by a "down draft" in Canada's capital markets. CVE, whose Q1 operating profit beat estimates with a 15% rise, says the smaller companies most likely to buy the assets are finding it difficult to find money to finance the purchase.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR -9.7%) hits levels last seen in July '12 thanks to disappointing results and...

    Juniper (JNPR -9.7%) hits levels last seen in July '12 thanks to disappointing results and guidance, and perhaps also AT&T's capex cuts. A 19% Q/Q and Y/Y Q1 sales drop for Juniper's security hardware ops, which have been losing share and are rumored to be on the block, is of particular concern to Stifel. "The company continues to struggle in its campus and branch office security portfolio and needs a focused strategy." Security weakness led enterprise sales to be roughly flat Y/Y. Service provider sales rose 4%, driven by core/edge router demand from U.S. telcos. Americas sales +11%, but EMEA -5% and Asia-Pac -9%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • LLY

    In what seems to be a trend in companies reporting today, Eli Lilly (LLY -3.6%) dips after...

    In what seems to be a trend in companies reporting today, Eli Lilly (LLY -3.6%) dips after posting a mixed Q1, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Net earnings rose 53% Y/Y, primarily from a gain from selling rights to a diabetes drug, but a slowdown in its Elanco animal-health kept overall revenue flat. LLY has been cultivating sales growth in its animal-health division as a strategy for getting through the wave of patent expirations, but sales in the unit rose only 2% for the quarter, compared to 21% growth during the same prior-year period.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +16.9%) shares have been pushing higher all day, although the only news is...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +16.9%) shares have been pushing higher all day, although the only news is the closing of the previously announced sale of Eagle Ford shale properties to Penn Virginia (PVA) for $401M. The stock actually received a downgrade, to Neutral from Add at CapitalOne; earlier this week, Deutsche Bank cut shares to Hold and chopped its price target in half.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 4 Comments
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming (BYD +21.2%) is among today's standouts after its Q3 report. Some color: momentum...

    Boyd Gaming (BYD +21.2%) is among today's standouts after its Q3 report. Some color: momentum picked up noticeably in March as BYD saw Y/Y EBITDA growth in its Las Vegas Locals business for the first time in over 12 months. The Peninsula Gaming acquisition added $133.9M in sales, helping to offset revenue declines in Boyd's portfolio. The company says "online gaming … provides a compelling opportunity to significantly grow" the business, a prospect Morgan Stanley is similarly optimistic about.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • CSL

    Carlisle (CSL -2.7%) Q1 EPS beat Street expectations but misses on revenue as organic sales fell...

    Carlisle (CSL -2.7%) Q1 EPS beat Street expectations but misses on revenue as organic sales fell 6.8% Y/Y, primarily due to lower demand in its Carlisle Brake & Friction business and sales declines in global off-highway equipment market. Losses were partially offset however, from better sales from recent acquisitions Carlisle Interconnect Technologies and Carlisle Construction Materials segments, which contributed 3.3% to sales on a net basis.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • ATGE

    More on DeVry's (DV -20.2%) Q3: A bottom line beat is overshadowed by a 17% decline in...

    More on DeVry's (DV -20.2%) Q3: A bottom line beat is overshadowed by a 17% decline in enrollment at the company's namesake university. CEO Daniel Hamburger blamed the slump on low cyclical demand occasioned by a weak economy, tepid job growth, and questions about the value of a college education. Average time from student inquiry to application rose to 50 days from 20. When asked by Deutsche's Adrienne Colby how high school enrollment trends were shaping up for July and September, Hamburger said: "Unfortunately, [they are] a little bit soft for us." (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • GOLD

    It's non-binding, but Barrick Gold (ABX +4.4%) shareholders vote against the miner's executive...

    It's non-binding, but Barrick Gold (ABX +4.4%) shareholders vote against the miner's executive compensation proposals, which includes a $17M pay package for new co-chairman John Thornton. Shareholder anger seems limited to lofty salaries despite the stock's 47% YTD drop, as they also agree to re-elect all 13 directors to ABX’s board.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 3 Comments
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR -2.8%) reverses gains made at the open to trade lower on a mixed Q1...

    Nabors Industries (NBR -2.8%) reverses gains made at the open to trade lower on a mixed Q1 result late yesterday. Net profits fell 26% Y/Y as the drilling contractor was hit by weaker profits across all its main business segments, including a steep decline in its U.S. drilling and rig-services division. During its call, the company noted that it's looking to shed its E&P assets, including its barges and jackup rigs, and says its hired an outside adviser to review its assets over the summer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • HTS

    Hatteras Financial (HTS -2%) continues to slip following the earnings call as KBW's Michael...

    Hatteras Financial (HTS -2%) continues to slip following the earnings call as KBW's Michael Widner says (CC transcript) his model - given rate spreads and company leverage - sees core earnings (and dividends) going forward as closer to  $0.60/share rather than the current payout of $0.70, and management does little to dissuade him of that view. (earnings earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM

    Shares of Polycom (PLCM -6%) slide in spite of an FQ2 beat, as guidance comes in below...

    Shares of Polycom (PLCM -6%) slide in spite of an FQ2 beat, as guidance comes in below expectations on delayed customer orders, particularly with regard to public-sector spending. It now sees Q2 EPS coming in at $0.13 - 0.15 on sales of $335M - 345M, versus analysts expectations for $0.14 on $353.60M in revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • SODA

    SodaStream (SODA +1.8%) trades higher after CEO Daniel Birnbaum tells Israeli business...

    SodaStream (SODA +1.8%) trades higher after CEO Daniel Birnbaum tells Israeli business daily Globes that the company has received orders beyond expectations. The exec also issued a warning to the Israeli government that the company will shift more production out of the country unless it sees a favorable business and tax atmosphere.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • GE

    GE (GE +1.7%) says its healthcare unit GE Healthcare announces a research collaboration...

    GE (GE +1.7%) says its healthcare unit GE Healthcare announces a research collaboration agreement with Eisai (OTCPK:ESALY, in which the Japanese pharmacuetical developer will use GEs investigational PET amyloid imaging agent to help select patients for a Phase I clinical Alzhiemers trial.     Even as many telecom equipment makers slump due to AT&T's capex cuts, Ericsson (ERIC +4.1%) is up after beating Q1 EPS estimates and providing upbeat commentary. Sales only rose 2% Y/Y - hardware +3%, global services +4%, support solutions (a relatively small business) -19% - and gross margin fell 130 bps Y/Y to 32%, something Ericsson attributes to projects that are initially low-margin. But in remarks that have to please those who see Ericsson as a mobile data traffic play, the company says it will see a higher mix of "capacity projects" in 2H. Rivals Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +2.3%) and Nokia (NOK +1.4%) are also higher, though a rally in European equities could be playing a role. (PR/slides)
